_header: O fresh flower most pleasant of praise
Subjects: love lyrics, satiric; dialogues, lovers’; satire
_description: A mocking love epistle by a lover in reply to his satirical mistress (see 6117) — eight stanzas rhyme royal, with introductory and concluding couplets

BodRawPoe36.First Lines:
O fresch floure most plesant of prysefragrant as sedyrsoy to mannys
                    inspeccoun…
BodRawPoe36.Last Lines:
…youre owne loue trusty and treweyou haue for sake cause of a
                    newer
BodRawPoe36.Note:
Preceded by introductory couplets, ‘Youre swete loue wyth blody
                    naylys / Whyche fedyth mo lyce than quaylis / O you dere herte variant and
                    mutable / Lyke to Caryldis whych is vn stable’
